comment: Has a pretty decent nose, sweet, nutty with a little acetone. Definitely has a good amount of heat and spice. Not worth a sip but makes a pretty good cocktail. When I go up to Vermont I always stop at Mad River’s bar for a cocktail, pretty much what I buy this for.
Good straight, makes a nice Manhattan. Good depth of flavor. I feel this is underrated, but depends on your pallet.
Young and oaky, corn and grains.
Liked it more the second time, upgraded to 3 stars. Hint of anise and mint at the end. Little oily in the mouth.
Sharp and a little rough on the follow through.
This is just an insult to bourbon unless you want some really backwood frontier bourbon straight from a still.
heavy ethanol/terpentine nose, similar to tequila. Spicy, caramel. Sweet with chemicals taste. not good
